metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9764 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
HashiCorp Consul 1.4.3 lacks server hostname verification for agent-to-agent TLS communication. In other words, the product behaves as if verify_server_hostname were set to false, even when it is actually set to true. This is fixed in 1.4.4.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

consul - 1.10.12+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Upstream says this only affects 1.4.3 and is fixed in 1.4.4 but it is not clear if earlier versions were affected or not so leaving as needs-triage for bionic with version 0.6.4~dfsg-3

criterions.comment: consul package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.12+dfsg1-1').
